result.execSummary:
The defendant Nawasa A King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Nawasa A King
Current: 5166 North Lovers Lane Road, Apt. A15, Milwaukee, WI 53225   (Effective: 04-19-2014)
Prior: 5166 North Lovers Lane Road, #a15, Milwaukee, WI 53225

Defendant Nawasa A King in court with attorney Dennis P Coffey.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant sentenced to serve 5 MONTHS consecutive to Count 2 in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 5 MONTHS consecutive to Count 1 in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review to be set by agent if needed.
-Successfully complete Anger Management counseling.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim or any childrenrising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-No corporal punishment.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Maintain employment.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Court modified the no contact order to a no violent contact order.

Defendant Nawasa A King in court with attorney Dennis P. Coffey.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2 OF THE AMENDED INFORMATION:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nawasa A King in court with attorney Nels Bjorkquist for Dennis P Coffey.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Scheduling Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nawasa A King in court with attorney Dennis P Coffey.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with T.P. (dob 9/20/2009) or Tyler P. (dob 9/20/2009) unless approved by the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Nawasa A King in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Christopher J Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/21/14 @ 1:30pm
